CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
11. joachimr., & smithj. (2019, November 19). We are relying on APA as our university style format - the university is located in Germany (Kassel). So I [Comment on the blog post “The transition to seventh edition APA Style”]. _APA Style_. https://apastyle.apa.org/blog/transition-seventh-edition#comment-4694866690

SOURCE TYPE: web page (blog comment)

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Authors: Initials should be capitalized and followed by a period.
   Should be: Joachimr., J., & Smithj., S.

❌ Title: The title of the blog comment should not be italicized.
   Should be: We are relying on APA as our university style format - the university is located in Germany (Kassel). So I

❌ Website Name: The blog name should be followed by a period.
   Should be: _APA Style_ .

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

ORIGINAL:
13. Price D. (2018, March 23). _laziness does not exist_. Medium https://humanparts.medium.com/laziness-does-not-exist-3af27e312d\n\n\n\n═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #1
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Belcher, W. (2019). Writing your journal article in twelve weeks: A guide to academic publishing success (2nd ed.) University of Chicago Press.

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title: The title of the book should be italicized, including the edition information.
   Should be: Belcher, W. (2019). _Writing your journal article in twelve weeks: A guide to academic publishing success_ (2nd ed.). University of Chicago Press.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CITATION #2
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
American Psychiatric Association, 1980 _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (3rd ed..)

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Author: There should be a period after the organization name.
   Should be: American Psychiatric Association.
❌ Publication Year: The year should be enclosed in parentheses.
   Should be: (1980).
❌ Title: The title should be followed by a period, and the edition abbreviation should be "ed." with a single period. The edition information should be italicized as part of the title string, or just before the final period if not part of the primary title. In APA 7th, the edition is part of the title element.
   Should be: _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (3rd ed.).
❌ Publisher: The publisher name is missing.
   Should be: American Psychiatric Association. (1980). _Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders_ (3rd ed.). American Psychiatric Association. (Assuming the American Psychiatric Association is also the publisher.)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Ganster D. C., Schaubroeck J., Sime W. E. & Mayes B. T. 1991 The nomological validity of the Type A personality among employed adults _Journal of Applied Psychology_ 76 1 143–168

SOURCE TYPE: journal article

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Authors: Initials should be followed by a period and a space (if there are multiple initials for a first name). There should be an ampersand (&) before the last author's name.
   Should be: Ganster, D. C., Schaubroeck, J., Sime, W. E., & Mayes, B. T.
❌ Publication Year: The year should be in parentheses.
   Should be: (1991).
❌ Article Title: The article title should end with a period\n\n\n\n═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Merriam-Webster; 2003. Litmus test. In _Merriam-Webster’s collegiate dictionary_ (11th ed., p. 727).

SOURCE TYPE: book chapter

VALIDATION RESULTS:
❌ Date: The year should be in parentheses and followed by a period.
   Should be: (2003).
❌ Entry Title: The title of the entry should not be italicized.
   Should be: Litmus test.
❌ Edition and Page Numbers: The period should come after the closing parenthesis for the page numbers.
   Should be: (11th ed., p. 727).
❌ Publisher: The publisher's name is missing. For a Merriam-Webster dictionary, the publisher is Merriam-Webster, Inc.
   Should be: Merriam-Webster, Inc.

ORIGINAL:
Perreault, L. (2019). Obesity in adults: Role of physical activity and exercise. _UpToDate_. Retrieved January 12, 2020, from https://www.uptodate.com/contents/obesity-in-adults-role-of-physical-activity-and-exercise

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Retrieved Date: The "Retrieved from" information is generally not included for sources that are not likely to change over time, such as articles from established online databases like UpToDate which have a clear publication date.
   Should be: Perreault, L. (2019). Obesity in adults: Role of physical activity and exercise. _UpToDate_. https://www.uptodate.com/contents/obesity-in-adults-role-of-physical-activity-and-exercise

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

ORIGINAL:
Numeroff, L. J. (2007). _If you give a mouse a cookie_ (F. Bond, Illus.). Laura Geringer Books. (Original work published 1985)

SOURCE TYPE: book

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Illustrator: In APA 7th edition, an illustrator is typically not included in the main reference entry unless they are also considered a co-author or the primary author. If the illustrator's contribution is significant, it might be mentioned in the text or a specific context, but not usually in the reference list in this format.
   Should be: Numeroff, L. J. (2007). _If you give a mouse a cookie_. Laura Geringer Books. (Original work published 1985)

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

SOURCE TYPE: journal article

ORIGINAL:
Scruton, R. (1996) _The eclipse of listening_ The New Criterion, 15(3), 5–13.

SOURCE TYPE: journal article

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Publication Year: The year should be in parentheses immediately after the author's name.
   Should be: Scruton, R. (1996)
❌ Article Title: The title of the article should not be italicized.
   Should be: The eclipse of listening
❌ Journal Title: The journal name should be italicized.
   Should be: _The New Criterion_
❌ Punctuation: There should be a period after the year, after the article title, and after the journal and volume/issue information.
   Should be: Scruton, R. (1996). The eclipse of listening. _The New Criterion_, 15(3), 5–13.

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

SOURCE TYPE: webpage

VALIDATION RESULTS:

❌ Title: The title of the article on the website should not be italicized. The name of the website should be italicized, which it is.
